Package fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl

Class TreeGraphNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.cnrs.iees.graph.ElementAdapter
      • fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl.ALNode
        • fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl.TreeGraphNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connected<Node>, Element, Node, Specialized, TreeNode, Identity, fr.ens.biologie.generic.Textable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TreeGraphDataNode, TreeGraphReadOnlyDataNode
    public class TreeGraphNode
extends ALNode
implements TreeNode

    The Node implementation to use with TreeGraph. A TreeGraphNode inherits both from TreeNode and from ALNode: it is a tree node which can have edges, ie "cross-links" within an otherwise hierarchical tree. The hierarchical relation (the tree) is kept separate from the other relations using Edges. The former is accessed using the TreeNode methods while the latter is accessed using the Node methods.

    By convention for node accessor methods and degrees, parent node is counted in the 'IN' direction while child nodes are counted in the 'OUT' direction.

    CAUTION: traversal(...) methods have not (yet) been overriden for this class. They are inherited from ALNode, which means they will ignore the tree structure and only return nodes accessible through cross-links.

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 14 mai 2019

      • nodes

        public java.util.Collection<? extends Node> nodes​(Direction direction)
        Returns all nodes linked in a given direction, parent being counted with the IN nodes and children with the OUT nodes. To only get the parent or the children nodes, use the more specific getParent() and getChildren() methods.
        Specified by:
        nodes in interface Node
        Overrides:
        nodes in class ALNode
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • toDetailedString

        public java.lang.String toDetailedString()
        Displays a TreeGraphNode as follows (on a single line): 
         node_label:node_name=[
    ↑parent_label:parent_name      // the parent node, or ROOT if null
    ↓child_label:child_name        // child node, repeated as needed
    →out_node_label:out_node_name  // end node of outgoing edge, repeated as needed
    ←in_node_label:in_node_name    // start node of incoming edge, repeated as needed
 ]

        e.g.: Node:0=[↑Node:1 ↓Node:2 ←Node:27 ←Node:4 →Node:5 →Node:18]

        Specified by:
        toDetailedString in interface fr.ens.biologie.generic.Textable
        Overrides:
        toDetailedString in class ALNode
